item.title: Help please!
item.dc:creator: @unleashed_pvp unleashed pvp
item.description:
@unleashed_pvp wrote:

case 411:
if(c.altarPrayed == 0) {
c.altarPrayed = 1;
c.setSidebarInterface(5, 22500);
c.startAnimation(645);
c.sendMessage(“Curses Activated”);
c.getCombat().resetPrayers();
c.getCurse().resetCurse();
} else {
c.altarPrayed = 0;
c.setSidebarInterface(5, 5608);
c.startAnimation(645);
c.sendMessage(“Curses Deactivated”);
c.getCurse().resetCurse();
c.getCombat().resetPrayers();
}
break;

Read full topic

item.title: Help please!
item.dc:creator: @chri55w chri55w
item.description:
@chri55w wrote:

assuming you are using PI (i think you are)

if you want to fix the message as in removing it, then i would strongly discourage you from doing so, it is very helpful when coding and it only shows up for players with playerRights == 3 however if you wish to remove it anyway

go to clickObject.java and find

comment out that line (put “//” at the start)

however if you mean that the object doesnt change the spellbook go to actionhandler.java and find

somewhere under there add this

case 411: if(c.altarPrayed == 0) { c.altarPrayed = 1; c.setSidebarInterface(5, 22500); c.startAnimation(645); c.sendMessage("Curses Activated"); c.getCombat().resetPrayers(); c.getCurse().resetCurse(); } else { c.altarPrayed = 0; c.setSidebarInterface(5, 5608); c.startAnimation(645); c.sendMessage("Curses Deactivated"); c.getCurse().resetCurse(); c.getCombat().resetPrayers(); } break;

Read full topic
